reason: The counterexample Pi_1=span{e1,e2}, Pi_2=span{e1,e4}, Pi_3=span{e3,e4}, Pi_4=span{e2,e3} requires coordinate convention (x1,x2,y1,y2) where omega(e_i,e_j) = 0 for i,j in {1,2} or {3,4}, i.e., omega = dx1^dy1+dx2^dy2 with e1=x1, e2=x2, e3=y1, e4=y2. Under the more common convention (x1,y1,x2,y2), Pi_1=span{e1,e2}=span{x1,y1} is NOT Lagrangian (omega(e1,e2) = dx1^dy1(x1,y1) = 1). The node does not specify which convention is used. This ambiguity must be resolved, as different readers may verify the example under different conventions and reach contradictory conclusions.
